nodes.bodyText: If this will actually prevent upload, we may want to bring it down to like 50. We can always triage/delete crappy issues, once we get them. But I could see myself getting frustrated if I had something really simple to share, but needed to pad it out to 140.

I think 140 characters is a reasonable requirement to help make sure the customer is actually providing a description of the issue. For reference, the following description (which still seems pretty short) is 148 characters:
"Some description of the issue would be added here. This description meets the minimum character count requirement. More information about the issue."
Okay, cool! Let's run with it.

re @richardmcclellan's observation - we could remove the explicit "Warning: " label, too? What's left will certainly still be and act as a warning, it just won't trigger the same psychological alarm, if we remove the declaration.

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    Warning: device and environment information will be included in the issue description.
          
          
            
                    Device and environment information will be included in the issue description.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,5 +35,6 @@
     <string name="copy_issue_text">Copy to Clipboard</string>
     <string name="file_issue_warning_text">
         Warning: device and environment information will be included in the issue description.
